meanings.definition: The belief in and worship of a superhuman controlling power, especially a personal God or gods.
meanings.sent1: Her family practices the same religion every Sunday at the church.
meanings.sent2: Many people find comfort in their religion during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a religion for napping in the sun every afternoon.
meanings.sent4: To him, football was not just a sport but a religion that consumed his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The religion of kindness and compassion guided her actions towards others.

meanings.definition: A particular system of faith and worship.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization had a unique religion that involved multiple deities.
meanings.sent2: Learning about different religions around the world can be fascinating.
meanings.sent3: His religion of always wearing mismatched socks made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, music was not just a hobby but a religion that connected souls.
meanings.sent5: The religion of nature's beauty inspired him to protect the environment.

meanings.definition: A pursuit or interest to which someone ascribes supreme importance.
meanings.sent1: For him, fishing was not just a hobby but a religion he followed religiously.
meanings.sent2: Her religion of collecting stamps brought her joy and fulfillment.
meanings.sent3: His religion of always being early to appointments impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: To her, reading was not just a pastime but a religion that enriched her mind.
meanings.sent5: The religion of spreading positivity and kindness brightened the atmosphere around her.
